Prosecutors hold people’s lives in their hands. It’s time for transparency about their decisions.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Prosecutors are some of the most powerful people in the criminal justice system. They hold people’s lives in their hands, but there is very little information about the decisions they make. If Connecticut is going to create a smarter justice system, all of us need more transparency on what prosecutors are doing.

Join us this Wednesday, May 22 at 11 a.m. in front of the Legislative Office Building in Hartford to support a bill to create a more transparent justice system.

Rally for Prosecutorial
Transparency, S.B. 880

Stand up for smart justice at the Capitol.

Wednesday, May 22, 11 a.m.
Connecticut State Capitol
Legislative Office Building
Outside the LOB
300 Capitol Avenue
Hartford, CT 06106

RSVP TODAY

S.B. 880 is a critical bill to create transparency about the decisions prosecutors make. This might be the last push before legislators vote on the bill. We need to pack the Legislative Office Building with Smart Justice supporters.

We will have bright blue Smart Justice shirts available for you, and Smart Justice staff will be there to welcome and greet you.

RSVP now to join us on Wednesday.

Thank you,

Anderson Curtis and Gus Marks-Hamilton
Smart Justice organizers, ACLU of Connecticut
